interface.name: zcr_text_input_extension_v1

description.summary: extends text_input to support richer operations

interface.description:
Allows a text_input to sends more variation of operations to support richer features, such as set_preedit_region.
Warning! The protocol described in this file is experimental and backward incompatible changes may be made. Backward compatible changes may be added together with the corresponding uinterface version bump. Backward incompatible changes are done by bumping the version number in the protocol and interface names and resetting the interface version. Once the protocol is to be declared stable, the 'z' prefix and the version number in the protocol and interface names are removed and the interface version number is reset.

entry.name: extended_text_input_exists
entry.summary: the text_input already has an extended_text_input object associated

request.name: get_extended_text_input
request.description: Create extended_text_input object. See zcr_extended_text_input interface for details. If the given text_input object already has a extended_text_input object associated, the extended_text_input_exists protocol error is raised.

interface.name: zcr_extended_text_input_v1
interface.description: The zcr_extended_text_input_v1 interface extends the text_input interface to support more rich operations on text_input.

event.name: set_preedit_region

description.summary: set preedit from the surrounding text

event.description:
IME requests to update text_input client to set the preedit from the surrounding text.
index is the starting point of the preedit, relative to the current cursor position in utf-8 byte-offset. length is the length of the preedit region in utf-8 byte length.
Following the convention we have in text_input::preedit_string, text_input::preedit_styling sent just before this will be applied.

enum.name: input_type
enum.description: Wayland has its own input-type support, which is zwp_text_input::content_purpose. However, it is not rich enough to represent all Chrome's input types. This enum is introduced to keep all entries so exo can understand it without any information loss. See TextInputType's description for details about each entry.

enum.name: input_mode
enum.description: Similar to input_type defined above, this keeps Chrome's TextInputMode. See TextInputMode's description for details for each entry.

enum.name: input_flags
enum.description: Similar to input_type defined above, this keeps Chrome's TextInputFlags, because content_hint is not enough power to represent what Chrome wants. See TextInputFlags' description for details for each entry.

description.summary: Whether IME is allowed to learn
Sets input type, mode and flags together

event.name: clear_grammar_fragments

description.summary: clear grammar fragments in a range

event.description:
IME requests to clear all the grammar markers within the given range defined by start and end.
start and end are relative to the beginning of the input field in utf-8 byte length.

event.name: add_grammar_fragment
event.description:
IME requests to add a new grammar fragment.
A grammar fragment describes a range of text (start, end) that has grammar error and also gives the correct replacement text. It is expected that the renderer will render markers (e.g. squigles or dashed underlines) under the text to notify users that there is a grammar error. It is also expected that the renderer will maintain and update the position of fragment when users edit other parts of the text, e.g. if users type something before the grammar fragment, the marker should move accordingly.
start and end are relative to the beginning of the input field in utf-8 byte length. suggestion is the correct replacement text, encoded in utf-8 and suggested by ML model.

request.name: set_grammar_fragment_at_cursor
request.description:
Informs the IME of the grammar fragment containing the current cursor. If not existing, both start and end are set to 0. This is called whenever the cursor position or surrounding text have changed.
start and end are relative to the beginning of the input field in utf-8 byte length. suggestion is the correct replacement text encoded in utf-8 and suggested by ML model.

event.name: set_autocorrect_range
event.description:
IME requests to update text_input client to set the autocorrect range. There is only one autocorrect range, so this replaces any existing autocorrect ranges.
start and end are relative to the beginning of the input field in utf-8 byte length.
If start and end are the same, then the autocorrect range is cleared.

request.name: set_autocorrect_info
request.description:
Informs the IME the range and bounds of the current autocorrect change. This is called whenever the range or bounds have changed.
start and end are relative to the beginning of the input field in utf-8 byte length.
x, y, width, and height are the bounds of the autocorrect text, relative to the window.
This request only changes a pending state that will be effective on the next 'set_surrounding_text' request.

event.name: set_virtual_keyboard_occluded_bounds

description.summary: Sets the virtual keyboard's occluded bounds.

event.description:
This event tells the client about the part of the virtual keyboard's bounds that occludes the text input's window, in screen DIP coordinates. In order for the text input to make proper use of this information, it needs to know its window's screen DIP bounds via another interface such as the aura-shell.
The occluded bounds may be smaller than the keyboard's visual bounds.
When the virtual keyboard is hidden or floating, empty bounds are sent, i.e. with zero width and height.

request.name: finalize_virtual_keyboard_changes

description.summary: Finalizes the requested virtual keyboard changes.

request.description:
This request notifies the server that the client has finished making requested changes to the virtual keyboard, and the server should update the client with the latest virtual keyboard state. This avoids spurious intermediate requests from causing the virtual keyboard to change state unnecessarily.
Clients that connect to the server at this or higher versions must send this request after it finishes sending the applicable requests. The server is free to decide how it handles or honors this request.
As of version 6, the applicable requests are: - zwp_text_input_v1.show_input_panel - zwp_text_input_v1.hide_input_panel

enum.name: focus_reason_type
enum.description: This represents the reasons why the text input gets focused.

request.name: set_focus_reason

description.summary: Specifies the reason of the following focus event

request.description:
Updates the reason why the following focus event is triggered. This should be called just before text_input::activate, and is in effect when it is called together (i.e. it is not in effect until text_input::activate is called).
`reason` is an extended parameter providing the mode for the next `text_input::active request`.

enum.name: inline_composition_support
enum.description: Inline composition is an IME feature for certain languages (e.g. CJK) which displays the uncommitted composition inside the input field as it is being typed.

request.name: set_input_type

description.summary: Sets input type, mode and flags together

request.description:
Used in place of zwp_text_input::set_content_type.
Instead of hint and purpose, this API uses concepts that more closely align with those used by Chrome.

request.name: set_surrounding_text_support

description.summary: Sets whether surrounding text is supported

request.description:
Some clients are not able to provide surrounding text or selection. When the server receives this request with the unsupproted enum, it will disable functionality relying on surrounding text and avoid sending events that depend on it like delete_surrounding_text, set_preedit_region and cursor_position.
This request will take effect on the next 'set_content_type' or 'set_input_type' request.
By default, the server will assume surrounding text is supported.

request.name: set_surrounding_text_offset_utf16
request.description:
This updates UTF-16 offset of the immediately following text_input::set_surrounding_text.
The value will be invalidated when the next set_surrounding_text comes (i.e., if two consecutive set_surrounding_text is called, the second set_surrounding_text's offset should be reset to 0).
Note: unlike other APIs, this is in "UTF-16" unit for Chrome's purpose, because there's no way to convert UTF-8 offset to UTF-16 without the original text, while sending whole text would cause performance concerns.

description.summary: How the selection range is affected by confirm_preedit

entry.name: after_preedit
entry.summary: The cursor is moved to the end of the committed preedit text, if any.

entry.name: unchanged
entry.summary: The selection range is not affected at all.

event.name: confirm_preedit
event.description: Commits the current preedit and modify the selection range according to selection_behavior. Has no effect if there's no preedit text.
